column4: why run my ubuntu in low graphics mode/failsafe ? why? how to change it to right?
tampered with your /etc/X11/xorg.conf, if you are using. if not you might need to use it
have some xorg.conf for intel graphics card?
na, only have one in my ibook g4, might help though, let me fire it up and paste it over, wanna have it?
yes i wanna have it
ok, gine my old ibook some time to fire up, its quite old
give*
i'll be back,
back
great. do you have it?
have a look at http://paste2.org/get/905563
no coments nor notes in so you are on you on
just an  advice, you might wanna comment out the modeline, they are specific to the size of the screen so my 12' inch ibook might not be having the same modeline as you X' inch creen
do you know what driver is for intel gma950 for write it to xorg.conf?
just use at
but google to be sure
said ati coz its a commin driver for most cards, do lspci } grep VGA , if you see anything like ati technologies then use ati, else {google(driver for ur card}
lspci | grep VGA
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Mobile 945GME Express Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 03)
well you had better found you driver through google or ask in this channel, the rest of the setting might work though, are you using lucid lynx?
yes, lucid lynx
lucid does not much require an xorg.conf unless its really needed like you case and my ibooks case
